The aftermath of an attack on US troops is no time to undercut the Commander in Chief's ability to protect our nation. Pelosi’s decision to move forward on this resolution will limit the President’s ability to respond appropriately to further attack by Iran and their proxies. https://t.co/czrNkNZt5A
(3/3) Trump showed his desire to find a peaceful resolution but has sent a clear message that America will protect its people and interests against continued provocation from Iran.

(2/3) The President made clear that war is not America’s goal. At the same time he made it clear America will not tolerate Iran’s continued efforts to destabilize the Middle East by pursuing nuclear weapons and sponsoring terror across the region.
(1/3) Surrounded by his national security team @POTUS Trump channeled Teddy Roosevelt: “speak softly and carry a big stick.” His statement showed restraint and resolve.
Iran’s decision to attack U.S. troops is not an act of retaliation it is a continuation of their ongoing efforts to destabilize the region and foment terror.

With help from the food bank we crafted legislation to create a grant program that will provide funds to help food banks transport food. The funds from these grants can help to not only feed those in need but also prevent food from being wasted.

Every year we visit food banks throughout the first district and ask them what we can do to help. This year Mountaineer Food bank told us they are having issues transporting donations. When we heard this our office got to work. https://t.co/PpUuaNuIvN
Former Vice President Biden’s comments show that like Hilary Clinton he plans to put thousands of coal miners out of work with no realistic plan for how they will provide for their families.

Learn to code? Seriously? We have a moral obligation to consider the human consequences of our policies. The radical left has so dehumanized the coal industry that the working men and women of these communities are being treated as collateral damage. https://t.co/He9HHqa0Eo
Qassem Soleimani death is a reminder that we will not allow attacks on American soldiers go unpunished.
After recent provocations by Iran – and the likelihood that they were planning more attacks on Americans -- President Trump responded appropriately by striking the leader orchestrating the attacks.
Qassem Soleimani was the architect of Iran’s support of terrorist organizations and is directly responsible for the deaths of hundreds of U.S. soldiers and thousands of innocent civilians.

For far too long NAFTA has allowed other countries to take advantage of American workers USMCA will level the playing field for our workers. I'm proud to have voted in favor of the USMCA and look forward to seeing it help our nation grow.
Trade with our North American partners is vital to West Virginia's economy exports to Mexico & Canada from our state totaled $1.5 billion in 2018.

This bill now heads to President Donald J. Trump to be signed into law. I am proud to have introduced this important legislation and to finally provide miners and their families with the peace of mind they deserve.

More than seventy years ago a promise was made by the federal government to our miners. Our office has been engaged in this effort for years and we are thrilled that the Senate has just passed legislation that will keep our government's promise to our Miners.

(4/4) Now the Senate will be forced to stop working on legislation and instead required to focus on a trial that will result in an acquittal. No reasonable person believes that 67 senators will vote to convict the president on the articles of impeachment.
(3/4) This vote sets a precedent that impeachment is no longer based on evidence but instead who holds the majority in the House.
(2/4) Today the House of Representatives has made our Founding Fathers’ fear a reality and for the first time in our nation’s history impeached a president on purely partisan lines.

(1/4) Alexander Hamilton warned in the Federalist Papers No. 65 that impeachment might become a way for Congress to remove a political opponent from office and that the decision could be driven by politics rather than a real demonstration of guilt.

The @USDA  Rural Utilities Service announced that they would invest $5.6 million in two high-speed broadband projects in Tyler & Wetzel counties! These investments will help to provide more than 3250 households and nearly 200 businesses with broadband!  https://t.co/6pUB92bibf

We are thankful for @SenCapito  and @Sen_JoeManchin leadership to make this bill a priority in the senate. I look forward to this agreement passing the Senate later this week and being signed into law.

Over the years we have worked to keep this issue front and center. So much hard work has gone into getting this legislation to this point and the retired miners and their families who made their voices heard in Congress deserve a lot of the credit. This has been a team effort

This agreement will provide peace of mind to the 100000 retirees widows and families who depend on the UMWA pension fund. After years of bipartisan effort that I have been proud to lead in the House we can see the end of the tunnel.

#BreakingNews Solution for Miners Pension and Health Care Passes the House!! For years we’ve been leading the fight to protect the pensions & health care benefits earned by retired miners. by the end of this week we can finally say our government is keeping its promise.

Today is the result of a multi-year bipartisan effort we led in the House working w/ @MineWorkers @SenCapito @Sen_JoeManchin and others. Eager to vote tomorrow and give peace of mind to 100k+ retired miners. We will get it done once and for all. (2/2)

After years of work to protect the pensions and health care earned by retired miners the finish line is in sight. Legislation to protect benefits EARNED by miners is included in the year-end deal released today. (1/2)

If lowering the cost of prescriptions were really a priority for Democrats they would have vote to adopt H.R. 19 #MoreCures  – the bipartisan amendment— instead of the politically charged bill H.R.3  #FewerCures. https://t.co/cgjlMwrVWQ

In contrast to H.R. 3  the bipartisan alternative H.R. 19 will not only lower drug prices but will protect innovation and research into new medicines and cures for diseases like Alzheimer's rheumatoid arthritis ALS diabetes and Parkinson's. #MoreCures

The Congressional Budget Office and the Council of Economic Advisers have all concluded that H.R. 3 will prevent hundreds of new cures from entering the market. I have to ask the supporters of H.R. 3 which cures for our loved ones are you willing to sacrifice?  #FewerCures.

I am happy to have worked with @RepLoriTrahan  and 104 of our colleagues in Congress to send a clear bipartisan message to MLB

Minor league baseball is an important part of the fabric of communities in all corners of America. These clubs employ thousands of people donate millions of dollars to local charities and provide families with affordable entertainment.

MLB's proposal to fundamentally change the minor league system would be a blow to small towns in West Virginia and across the nation. I am proud to help lead this effort to protect minor league baseball and the communities it serves.

We must not only remember what we saw but we must ensure the memory of those lost and the bravery of our first responders and troops in the aftermath of the attack lives on.

Eighteen years ago nearly 3000 Americans lost their lives in the most devastating act of terrorism this nation has ever seen. We must never forget the horrific scenes we witnessed or the pride and patriotism that brought us together in that time of national mourning.
